CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court;Reasonable time);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , the current applicant 's mother , brought proceedings in the Benevento Magistrate ’s Court , sitting as an employment tribunal , seeking acknowledgment of her right to an invalidity pension ( pensione di inabilità ) and an attendance allowance ( indennità di accompagnamento ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the magistrate 's court fixed the first hearing for DATE . On DATE the court appointed an expert and adjourned the proceedings to a hearing on DATE .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on DATE , the court dismissed PERSON claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged an appeal with ORG . The president of the court designated a judge rapporteur and set the appeal down for a hearing on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , also on DATE , PERSON died . On DATE the applicant joined the proceedings . A hearing was to be held on DATE . In a judgment of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on DATE , the court upheld PERSON claim as of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application with ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , known as the “ Pinto ” Act , complaining of the excessive length of the above - described proceedings . The applicant requested the court to rule that there had been a breach of LAW and to order ORG to pay compensation for the non - pecuniary damage sustained , which he assessed at MONEY ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on DATE , ORG found that a reasonable time had been exceeded . It awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage and EUR CARDINAL for costs and expenses . The decision became final by DATE at the latest .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed ORG outcome of the domestic proceedings and asked it to resume its examination of the application . According to the information provided by the applicant on DATE , the authorities had not yet enforced ORG decision .
